repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
This is #5242 with a twist to support array initialisation with const variable passed to array size.

in detail this PR:
* to overcome MSVC limitations, value is copied directly when const variables are assigned:
  ```cython
  cdef const int b = 5
  cdef const int a = b  # value 5 is used for initialisation of `a` in the generated C code
  ```

* to overcome C limitation, value is copied directly when const variable is used as array size initializer:
   ```cython
   cdef const int a = 5
   cdef float[a] b.         # value 5 is used for array size in the generated C code
   ```

There are still rough edges that needs to be touched though - see `FIXME` comments in test files.

commit.message: Dont use initialisation in the separate line
Error out when array dimension is const
Add support for array size initialization
Add support of MSVC and improve tests

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.7.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.
* Support and use `am_send` for coroutines.

title: Allow initialisation of global const variables 2nd attempt
